attributes.action: Stand in opposition to growing pressure from EU officials to 'force' a second Irish referendum on the Lisbon Treaty.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: On 12th June 2008 the Irish said NO to the Lisbon Treaty. Their constitutional right to a referendum on this issue allowed them to fully experience democracy in real terms and they made it clear where they stood on the issue -They voted NO. The British government while standing for and promoting democracy across the globe didn't allow British citizens the democratic freedom to vote for or against the Lisbon Treaty themselves, but now the Irish have said NO the British government should uphold the Irish peoples decision in the name of democracy and support the Irish against increasing pressure from French and German officials to hold a second referendum.
